intro: Teesdalia irregularis, commonly known as the irregular daisy, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its distinctive, irregularly shaped yellow flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in full sun. It has narrow, linear leaves and produces small, inconspicuous flowers that bloom in summer. Teesdalia irregularis is often cultivated for its ornamental value and is relatively drought-tolerant.
